ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.parameters module¶

ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.parameters.next_parameter_generator(parameters: dict, step_size: dict, constraints: dict, slient: bool = False) → Generator¶

Generator generating the parameter to be optimized

Parameters:
  • parameters – the parameter to be optimized
  • sensitivities – the information about the maximum change of parameter values
  • constraints – the constraints of the paramters
Yields:
  • idx – the index of the parameter to be perturbed
  • values[‘value’] – the array object containing the parameters value
  • step_size[category_name][‘value’][idx] – the maximum step_size of the parameter to be moved
  • constraints[category_name][‘lower_bound’][idx] – the lower bound of the parameter values
  • constraints[category_name][‘upper_bound’][idx] – the upper bound of the parameter values
ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.parameters.is_equal(parameters_a: dict, parameters_b: dict) → bool¶

Check whether two set of parameters values is equal or not with a tolrence 1e-5

Parameters:
  • parameters_a – the first set of parameters
  • parameters_b – the second set of parameters
Returns:

  • True if both of them are equal
  • False otherwise

ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.step_size module¶

ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.step_size.get_default_step_size(optimization_level: int = 0) → dict¶

Get the default step size by the optimization level

Parameters:optimization_level – optimization level range from 0 to 5 where level 0 is the QEq parameters
Returns:step_size – np.ndarray object of the step size
Return type:np.ndarray

See also

ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.next_parameter_generator(parameters: dict, step_size: dict, constraints: dict, slient: bool = False) → Generator¶

Generator generating the parameter to be optimized

Parameters:
  • parameters – the parameter to be optimized
  • sensitivities – the information about the maximum change of parameter values
  • constraints – the constraints of the paramters
Yields:
  • idx – the index of the parameter to be perturbed
  • values[‘value’] – the array object containing the parameters value
  • step_size[category_name][‘value’][idx] – the maximum step_size of the parameter to be moved
  • constraints[category_name][‘lower_bound’][idx] – the lower bound of the parameter values
  • constraints[category_name][‘upper_bound’][idx] – the upper bound of the parameter values
ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.is_equal(parameters_a: dict, parameters_b: dict) → bool¶

Check whether two set of parameters values is equal or not with a tolrence 1e-5

Parameters:
  • parameters_a – the first set of parameters
  • parameters_b – the second set of parameters
Returns:

  • True if both of them are equal
  • False otherwise
ff_optimum.user_packages.reaxff.optimization_setting.get_default_step_size(optimization_level: int = 0) → dict¶

Get the default step size by the optimization level
